panels.headline: Houthi Forces Launch Initial Red Sea Campaign Against Shipping

key_events.description: Houthi forces launch ballistic missiles toward Israel, opening maritime campaign
key_events.source_title: Houthi forces fire missiles toward Israel in show of solidarity with Gaza

key_events.description: Houthis seize Galaxy Leader cargo ship in Red Sea, first direct vessel seizure
key_events.source_title: Houthis seize Israeli-linked cargo ship Galaxy Leader in Red Sea

panels.narrative_summary: In the initial phase, Houthi forces (Ansar Allah) began a sustained military campaign targeting shipping in the Red Sea and Bab el-Mandeb Strait in solidarity with Gaza. The seizure of the Galaxy Leader marked the first direct vessel capture and set the precedent for subsequent interdictions.

panels.headline: US-Led Coalition Forms as Houthi Attacks Escalate to Critical Infrastructure

key_events.description: United States announces Operation Prosperity Guardian coalition to protect Red Sea shipping
key_events.source_title: US announces multinational military operation to protect Red Sea shipping

key_events.description: US and UK conduct joint airstrikes on Houthi targets in Yemen
key_events.source_title: US and UK launch military strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen

panels.narrative_summary: Escalating Houthi attacks on commercial shipping prompted the United States to form Operation Prosperity Guardian, a multinational coalition. When attacks continued, the US and UK launched direct airstrikes on Houthi military installations in Yemen, marking a significant escalation of international military involvement.

recommended_followup: Monitor Houthi missile acquisition from Iran
Track commercial shipping rerouting around Cape of Good Hope
